meanings.definition: Quant: a quantitative analyst or researcher in finance.
meanings.sent1: The quants at the bank analyze financial data to make predictions.
meanings.sent2: She aspires to become one of the quants working on Wall Street.
meanings.sent3: The quants at the office always have their calculators ready for number crunching.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, the quants are the wizards behind the numbers.
meanings.sent5: The quants' expertise in quantitative analysis is highly sought after in the industry.

meanings.definition: Quant: to estimate or calculate the quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: He quants the ingredients carefully before baking the cake.
meanings.sent2: It is important to quant the budget before making any financial decisions.
meanings.sent3: She likes to quant the number of steps she takes each day just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The scientist needs to quant the amount of liquid in the beaker for the experiment.
meanings.sent5: You should always quant the time needed for each task to manage your day efficiently.

meanings.definition: Quant: a small amount or portion of something.
meanings.sent1: Could you pass me a quants of sugar for my coffee?
meanings.sent2: He only needs a quants of paint to touch up the wall.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a quants of spice to the soup for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: She took just a quants of time to finish the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: A quants of patience can go a long way in dealing with difficult situations.
